dt: {bc}to bring a bodily part into contact with especially so as to perceive through the tactile sense {bc}handle or feel gently usually with the intent to understand or appreciate
{bc}to put hands upon in any way or degree

dt.t: don't {wi}touch{/wi} anything before the police come

dt: {bc}to take into the hands or mouth
{bc}to strike or push lightly especially with the hand or foot or an implement
{bc}to cause to be briefly in contact or conjunction with something

dt.t: a sticky situation and I wouldn't {wi}touch{/wi} it with a 10-foot pole
nothing can {wi}touch{/wi} that cloth for durability

dt: {bc}to speak or tell of especially in passing

dt.t: barely {wi}touched{/wi} the incident in the speech

dt: {bc}to leave a mark or impression on
{bc}to harm slightly by or as if by contact {bc}{sx|taint||}, {sx|blemish||}
{bc}to give a delicate tint, line, or expression to
{bc}to get a hit off or score a run against
{bc}to draw or delineate with light strokes
{bc}to lay hands upon (one afflicted with scrofula) with intent to heal
{bc}to perform (a melody) by playing or singing
{bc}to feel something with a body part (such as the hand or foot)
{bc}to lay hand or finger on a person to cure disease (such as scrofula)
{bc}to treat a topic in a brief or casual manner
{bc}to make a brief or incidental stop on shore during a trip by water

dt.t: coming in from the cold to {it}touch base{/it} with civilization

pt: {sc}affect{/sc} {sc}influence{/sc} {sc}touch{/sc} {sc}impress{/sc} {sc}strike{/sc} {sc}sway{/sc} mean to produce or have an effect upon. {sc}affect{/sc} implies the action of a stimulus that can produce a response or reaction.
{sc}influence{/sc} implies a force that brings about a change (as in nature or behavior).

pt.t: our beliefs are {it}influenced{/it} by our upbringing

pt: {sc}touch{/sc} may carry a vivid suggestion of close contact and may connote stirring, arousing, or harming.

pt.t: his emotions were {it}touched{/it} by her distress

pt: {sc}impress{/sc} stresses the depth and persistence of the effect.

pt.t: only one of the plans {it}impressed{/it} him

pt: {sc}strike{/sc}, similar to but weaker than {it}impress{/it}, may convey the notion of sudden sharp perception or appreciation.

pt.t: {it}struck{/it} by the solemnity of the occasion

pt: {sc}sway{/sc} implies the acting of influences that are not resisted or are irresistible, with resulting change in character or course of action.

pt.t: politicians who are {it}swayed{/it} by popular opinion

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}tucher, tuchier{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*toccare{/it} to knock, strike a bell, touch, probably of imitative origin
shortdef: to bring a bodily part into contact with especially so as to perceive through the tactile sense : handle or feel gently usually with the intent to understand or appreciate
to put hands upon in any way or degree; especially : to commit violence upon
to take into the hands or mouth

dt: {bc}the act or an instance of handling or controlling a ball (as in basketball or soccer)
{bc}the special sense by which pressure or traction exerted on the skin or mucous membrane is perceived
{bc}a specified sensation that arises in response to stimulation of the tactile receptors {bc}{sx|feel||}
{bc}a hit against an opponent in fencing

dt.t: applies the finishing {wi}touches{/wi} to the story

dt: {bc}distinctive and often effective manner or method
{bc}a characteristic or distinguishing trait or quality
{bc}mental or moral sensitiveness, responsiveness, or tact
{bc}something slight of its kind: such as

dt.t: a {wi}touch{/wi} of spring in the air
beaten in the championships by a mere {wi}touch{/wi}

dt: {bc}the state or fact of being in contact or communication or of having awareness
{bc}a manner or method of touching or striking especially the keys of a keyboard instrument
{bc}ability to precisely control the path and speed of a shot or pass
{bc}the area outside of the {a_link|touchlines} in soccer or outside of and including the touchlines in rugby
{bc}particular action of a keyboard with reference to the resistance of its keys to pressure
{bc}the playing of an instrument (such as a lute or piano) with the fingers
used chiefly in the phrase {it}put to the touch{/it}
{bc}the act of rubbing gold or silver on a {a_link|touchstone} to test its quality
{bc}a set of changes in change ringing that is less than a peal
{bc}an act of soliciting or getting a gift or loan

dt.t: aimed {it}a touch{/it} too low and missed

shortdef: the act or fact of touching; also : the act or an instance of handling or controlling a ball (as in basketball or soccer)
the special sense by which pressure or traction exerted on the skin or mucous membrane is perceived
a specified sensation that arises in response to stimulation of the tactile receptors : feel

dt: {bc}an airplane landing followed immediately by application of power and a takeoff and usually executed as one of a series for practice at landings

shortdef: an airplane landing followed immediately by application of power and a takeoff and usually executed as one of a series for practice at landings

dt.t: it was {it}touch and go{/it} there for a while

dt: {bc}to place (the ball in rugby) by hand on the ground on or over an opponent's goal line in scoring a try or behind one's own goal line as a defensive measure

shortdef: to place (the ball in rugby) by hand on the ground on or over an opponent's goal line in scoring a try or behind one's own goal line as a defensive measure

dt: {bc}football played informally and chiefly characterized by the substitution of touching for tackling

shortdef: football played informally and chiefly characterized by the substitution of touching for tackling

dt: {bc}either of two North American impatiens growing in moist areas: such as
{bc}one ({it}Impatiens capensis{/it}) typically having orange flowers spotted with reddish brown
{bc}one ({it}I. pallida{/it}) having typically yellow flowers sometimes spotted with reddish brown

et: from the bursting of the ripe pods and scattering of their seeds when touched
shortdef: either of two North American impatiens growing in moist areas: such as
one (Impatiens capensis) typically having orange flowers spotted with reddish brown
one (I. pallida) having typically yellow flowers sometimes spotted with reddish brown

dt: {bc}to provoke or initiate with sudden intensity
{bc}to cause to explode by or as if by touching with fire

shortdef: to provoke or initiate with sudden intensity
to cause to explode by or as if by touching with fire
to describe or characterize with precision

dt: {bc}a keypad for an electronic device (such as a microwave oven) that consists of a flat surface divided into several differently marked areas which are touched to choose options

shortdef: a keypad for an electronic device (such as a microwave oven) that consists of a flat surface divided into several differently marked areas which are touched to choose options

dt: {bc}a display screen on which the user selects options (as from a menu) by touching the screen

shortdef: a display screen on which the user selects options (as from a menu) by touching the screen
